posts.author: greyfey
posts.content:
Im a bit new too Cleric,s but after reading the guides here,want too make one on the multiplayer server I use.

Looked through and settled for The Demolition Man as an excellent base but then thought "Hmm, i,ll tweak it!"

I wanted too drop the weapon feats ,and go for spell focus conjuration too,after all they do talk about the firestorm,SoV combo...sounds really cool!

So,looked through the wiki,took sling and pointblank for plinking,and yay!,I can fit it in,checked out the nwnwiki and....Handbrake!...says that Evocation and Conjuration are opposites!

Well,for Arcane caster,s,but,dang...it doesn't say if cleric,s can focus in both or not,so in a nutshell,

can cleric,s take Spell focus,Grt spell focus and Epic spell focus in both Evocation and Conjuration ?

Sorry if this is obvious,but for the life of me I cant see it anywhere,any help appreciated.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
greyfey wrote:...says that Evocation and Conjuration are opposites!
Specialist wizards can not learn spells from the school that is the opposite of the one they specialize in. All other casters can learn spells from any school.
can cleric,s take Spell focus,Grt spell focus and Epic spell focus in both Evocation and Conjuration ?

Yes

posts.author: greyfey
posts.content: Woohoo1..made my day! thanks

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
As the builder who designed the Demolition Man, I can vouch for these tweaks.

The world for which I built him had some cool custom specifics for archers, like, for example, the possibility of using Darkfire on Arrows and GMW on bows, which made the sniping option that much more attractive, but if you want to make him more of a caster, perhaps you should also take feats as Empower and Extend spells, because they add versatility to the build and spellbook. Still Spell and Maximize as well. Go for broke, brother!

Take it EZ!
